definition: slightly/a little/somewhat
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
child/son
non-syllabic diminutive suffix/retroflex final

sentences.english: She seems like a kook, but she is just grand, really.
sentences.chinese: 她看上去有点儿怪，不过她确实是个好人儿。

sentences.english: His remarks irritated me a little.
sentences.chinese: 他的话让我有点儿恼火。

sentences.english: They're a bit foxed by the colours of the riders' jerseys and hats.
sentences.chinese: 自行车手运动衫和帽子的颜色让他们有点儿困惑。

sentences.english: Lily:I'm sorry, I'm feeling carsick. Would you drive a little slower, please?
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我有点儿晕车。能开慢点儿吗？

sentences.english: Some people may think this dish is sightly hot for their taste.
sentences.chinese: 有些人会觉得对他们的口味来说，这道莱有点儿辣。

sentences.english: OK.And if I substitute it again, This is going by a little fast.
sentences.chinese: 如果继续下去就是，这有点儿快。

sentences.english: It was just a little too preachy-sounding, Mr. Vitrano says.
sentences.chinese: 维特拉诺说，听上去有点儿像是在说教。

sentences.english: Then wed have some ideas of what youll be needing.
sentences.chinese: 那么我们就会意中有点儿数，晓得你们需求什么了。

sentences.english: You may find this a bit overcomplicated, so I will simplify it.
sentences.chinese: 您可能发现这有点儿过于复杂，所以我将简化它。

sentences.english: 'There's got to be a little gallows humor to get you through the day,' Mr. Obama said.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马说，总得有点儿黑色幽默让人们撑下去。

sentences.english: It’s sort of like punching your bride right before saying “I do”.
sentences.chinese: 这有点儿像在你说“我愿意”之前把你的新娘打一顿。

sentences.english: The beehive did sort of look like a big brown bear now.
sentences.chinese: 蜂巢现在看起来的确有点儿像一只大棕熊。

sentences.english: The clothes feel a bit damp.
It's a little overweight. You have to pay extra.
sentences.chinese: 有点儿超重了，您得付超重费。

sentences.english: The bird is not itself today.
sentences.chinese: 这只鸟今天有点儿反常。

definition: a little
straight/erect/to stick out (a part of the body)/to (physically) straighten up/to support/to withstand/outstanding/(coll.) quite/very/classifier for machine guns
erhua variant of 點|点[dian3]
a little/somewhat
a bit/a little
erhua variant of 一點|一点[yi1 dian3]
to think/to feel
barbarian/bullying/very/quite/rough/reckless
to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly
classifier indicating a small amount or small number greater than 1: some, a few, several
to have guts/to have courage/to be brave
to appear to be/to seem as if
highest/greatest/too (much)/very/extremely
very good
returning to our main topic,.../that said,.../again,.../in this connection/in passing/nevertheless,.../anyhow
contrary to what one might expect/actually/contrariwise/why don't you
